medical_history.chief_complaint: Periumbilical abdominal pain migrating to right lower quadrant (RLQ)
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain began suddenly 12 hours prior to presentation, originally periumbilical and less severe than earlier. The pain has a twisting quality and does not radiate. Patient reports anorexia and denies nausea, vomiting, fever, chills, diarrhea, changes in urination, shortness of breath, chest pain, and leg pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1. Nephrolithiasis 2. Hypertension 3. Dyslipidemia 4. History of DVT, previously on rivaroxaban; Not on anticoagulation currently.
